{"step_by_step_thinking": "Oil Red O stain is used for staining lipids and triglycerides. It is commonly used to visualize fat or lipid droplets in tissues. Based on the provided documents, it is mentioned that Oil Red O stain is used for staining neutral triglycerides and lipids on frozen sections, as well as some lipoproteins on paraffin sections. It is also used for staining fat in various cuts in pathology and for staining latent fingerprints on porous exhibits. From this information, we can conclude that Oil Red O stain is used for frozen specimens.", "answer_choice": "D. Frozen specimen"}
